decision_conditions: The Pine is twin-stemmed and situated within the front garden of 6 Windrush Close. It is highly
visible and the largest tree within the street scene. As a result it has a high amenity and significantly
contributes to the arboreal character of the local area.
Two applications were received at the same time to fell this tree, One from the property owner and
one from the insurance company. Only One application was validated however the supporting
evidence on both has been assessed. (other reference 12560/TRE/2023/306).
It is alleged that damage has occurred to the property and that this is linked to the Pine tree and
other vegetation within the property. The other vegetation/ trees are not protected and as a result
their removal/ management does not require council permission.
Within the "reasons for work" document it states that a root barrier might be a viable option meaning
that the tree can remain as an important amenity value. As other options have not yet been
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
description: To remove One Pine at T1 within TPO 740.
